channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2024060039
item.description:
Report I-2024060039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T00:38:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: STOCKBRIDGE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 60125
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: TOTE LOADED ONTO TRAILER ALONG WITH OTHER FREIGHT FOR TRANSPORT. FREIGHT SHIFTED AND WAS PUNCTURED BY A FORKLIFT BLADE BEING SHIPPED. THE PUNCTURE WAS APPROXIMATE 3 INCHES WIDE AND 1 INCH THICK. HAZMAT 1 CONTACTED FOR REMEDIATION AS WELL AS EMERGENCY SERVICES INCLUDING EPA.

item.title: Report X-2024072198
item.description:
Report X-2024072198

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Car appeared to have been hard coupled from humping operations that caused a crumpling of the A end left side pushing the truck assembly up to the first hopper and the stubsill down at the coupler. This crumpling caused a tear in the well of the A end hopper approximately 6' long by 1/2" wide.

item.title: Report I-2024070085
item.description:
Report I-2024070085

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T18:16:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: Saddle Brook
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1025
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 22 : 11 a package containing an undelcared 6000Wh lithium ion battery, with terminals unprotected, was placed on the metal grating outside of door 102. Moments later, the package started emitting smoke and plant engineering was notified. The package caught on fire and employees evacuated the building as the fire department was called. A mechanic and his supervisor attempted to extinguish the fire but it kept reigniting. The fire department arrived, pulled the package outside, and extinguished it. At 22:58. the fire department gave the 'all cleaT to return to the building.
